types.name: Amount
types.description: Monetary amount with the corresponding currency code.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: Currency code of the amount in ISO 4217 format.

types.name: Analytics_vendorAnalytics_2024_09_30
types.description: Root type for Vendor Analytics queries version 2024_09_30.

fields.name: manufacturingView
fields.description: The manufacturing view provides metrics about products manufactured by the Vendor.

args.name: aggregateBy
args.description: Determines how the data should be aggregated, e.g. daily, weekly, monthly.

args.name: currencyCode
args.description: Currency code for all monetary amounts in ISO 4217 format. If not provided, amounts will be returned in USD.

args.name: endDate
args.description: The end date of the vendor analytics data to retrieve.

args.name: startDate
args.description: The start date of the vendor analytics data to retrieve. The start date must be no more than two years ago.

fields.name: sourcingView
fields.description:
The sourcing view provides metrics about products that are sourced directly
from the Vendor to Amazon (i.e., when the Vendor is a distributor).

args.name: aggregateBy
args.description: Determines how the data should be aggregated, e.g. daily, weekly, monthly.

args.name: currencyCode
args.description: Currency code for all monetary amounts in ISO 4217 format. If not provided, amounts will be returned in USD.

args.name: endDate
args.description: The end date of the vendor analytics data to retrieve.

args.name: startDate
args.description: The start date of the vendor analytics data to retrieve. The start date must be no more than two years ago.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Represents `true` or `false` values.

types.name: Costs
types.description: Costs metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: averageSalesDiscount
fields.description:
The average selling discount per unit of shipped items. The average sales
discount is equal to the sales discount divided by the shipped quantity.

fields.name: contraCogs
fields.description:
The total Contra Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), equal to the dollars realized by
customer outbound shipments minus Display Ads Contra COGS.

fields.name: contraCogsPerUnit
fields.description:
The average Vendor Funded Contra-COGS (VFCC) of shipped items. Contra-COGS per
unit is equal to Contra-COGS divided by the shipped quantity.

fields.name: netPPM
fields.description:
Net Pure Product Margin (PPM) is defined as Amazon's margin after taking into
account CCOGs and sales discounts. Net PPM = (Shipped Revenue - Shipped CCOGS
+ CCOGS - Sales Discount) / Shipped Revenue.

fields.name: salesDiscount
fields.description:
Sales Discount is a transactional component of CP (Contribution Profit Amount)
related to promotional activities that Amazon conducts at checkout, such as
promotion code redemptions, giftcard promotions, employee discount, etc. Sales
Discounts = Eligible Promotions + Promotional Giftcards Amount + Bounceback
Promotion Amount + Cross-GL Bounceback Amount + Loyalty Points Amount

fields.name: shippedCogs
fields.description:
The shipped cost of goods sold (COGS), which is the price Amazon paid to a
vendor for item procurement, and is a component of contribution profit.

types.name: CustomerReturnTopics
types.description: Customer return topics metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: browseNodeReturnTopicTrends
fields.description:
Month-over-month trends of the ten most common topics based on customer return
comments aggregated across all ASINs within the browse node (product category)
associated with this ASIN. For each topic, the occurrence percentage is shown
for each of the past six months.

fields.name: browseNodeReturnTopics
fields.description:
The ten most common topics based on customer return comments, aggregated
across all ASINs within the browse node (product category) associated with
this ASIN, along with the occurrence percentage of each topic.

types.name: CustomerReviewTopics
types.description: Customer review topics metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: negativeReviewTopicImpactOnStarRating
fields.description:
The ten most common negative topics extracted from customer reviews, based on how each topic impacts the star rating.
ASIN metrics include each topic's impact value for both the ASIN and the corresponding Parent ASIN.
Browse node metrics include each topic's impact value for both the overall
browse node and the top 25% of products within it.

fields.name: negativeReviewTopicTrends
fields.description:
Month-over-month trends of the ten most common negative topics based on customer reviews.
ASIN metrics include the occurrence percentage at both the ASIN and Parent ASIN level for each of the past six months.
Browse node metrics include the occurrence percentage at both the overall
browse node level and among the top 25% of products within the browse node,
for each of the past six months.

fields.name: negativeReviewTopics
fields.description:
The ten most common negative topics based on customer reviews. For each topic,
the top three associated snippets are provided verbatim. Additionally, the top
five subtopics for each topic and the top three verbatim quotes are provided.
ASIN metrics include the number of mentions and occurrence percentage of each topic or subtopic.
Browse node metrics include the occurrence percentage of the topic or subtopic at the overall browse node level.

fields.name: positiveReviewTopicImpactOnStarRating
fields.description:
The ten most common positive topics extracted from customer reviews, based on how each topic impacts the star rating.
ASIN metrics show each topic's impact value for both the ASIN and the corresponding Parent ASIN.
Browse node metrics show each topic's impact value for both the overall browse node and the top 25% of products within it.

fields.name: positiveReviewTopicTrends
fields.description:
Month-over-month trends of the ten most common positive topics based on customer reviews.
ASIN metrics show the occurrence percentage at both the ASIN and Parent ASIN level for each of the past six months.
Browse node metrics show the occurrence percentage at both the overall browse
node level and among the top 25% of products within the browse node, for each
of the past six months.

fields.name: positiveReviewTopics
fields.description:
The ten most common positive topics based on customer reviews. For each topic,
the top three associated snippets are provided verbatim. Additionally, the top
five subtopics are included for each topic, along with the top three verbatim quotes.
ASIN metrics include the number of mentions and occurrence percentage of each topic or subtopic.
Browse node metrics include the occurrence percentage of the topic or subtopic at the overall browse node level.

types.name: CustomerReviews
types.description: Customer review metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: asinReviewTopics
fields.description: Topics based on customer reviews for an ASIN.

fields.name: browseNodeReviewTopics
fields.description:
Topics based on customer reviews, aggregated across all ASINs within the
browse node (product category) associated with this ASIN.

types.name: CustomerSatisfaction
types.description: Customer satisfaction metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: customerReturnTopics
fields.description: Customer return topics metric group.

fields.name: customerReturns
fields.description: The number of items returned as recorded on the Customer Returns transaction table.

fields.name: customerReviews
fields.description: Customer reviews metric group.

types.name: Date
types.description: RFC-3339 compliant Full Date Scalar. Example: "2023-11-15".

types.name: DateGranularity
types.description: Date granularity used in aggregation.

enumValues.name: DAY
enumValues.description: Metrics are aggregated by day.

enumValues.name: MONTH
enumValues.description: Metrics are aggregated by month.

enumValues.name: WEEK
enumValues.description: Metrics are aggregated by week.

types.name: Float
types.description: Represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ForecastedDemandStatistic
types.description: Amazon's estimate that customer demand will be at or below this value.

fields.name: mean
fields.description: Amazon’s best estimate of weekly customer demand (in units). This estimate does not account for safety stock.

fields.name: p70
fields.description: Amazon estimates that there is a 70% probability that customer demand will be at or below this number of units.

fields.name: p80
fields.description: Amazon estimates that there is a 80% probability that customer demand will be at or below this number of units.

fields.name: p90
fields.description: Amazon estimates that there is a 90% probability that customer demand will be at or below this number of units.

types.name: ForecastedDemandWeekly
types.description: Forecasted customer demand by week. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: demand
fields.description: Amazon's estimate that customer demand will be at or below this value.

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: End date of the forecasting range.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: Start date of the forecasting range.

fields.name: weekNumber
fields.description: Week number of the forecasting range.

types.name: GroupByAttributes
types.description: Group by attributes, essentially catalog attributes, some of which can be null, e.g., group by brand.

fields.name: asin
fields.description: Amazon Standard Identification Number, used to uniquely identify products in Amazon's catalog.

fields.name: binding
fields.description: The format or type of the item, such as Hardcover, T-Shirt, or DVD-Audio.

fields.name: brand
fields.description: Brand name.

fields.name: brandCode
fields.description: Amazon brand code for the owning brand.

fields.name: color
fields.description: The color of the item, such as Red, Navy Blue, Pink, or Green.

fields.name: ean
fields.description: European Article Number. A 13-digit product identifier, often represented on products as a barcode.

fields.name: isbn13
fields.description: 13-digit International Standard Book Number.

fields.name: manufacturerCode
fields.description: Code used to identify the manufacturer, an entity who makes the products that are sold on Amazon.

fields.name: modelNumber
fields.description: The model or style number of the product.

fields.name: msrp
fields.description: The manufacturer's suggested retail price (MSRP) of the item. Also known as the list price.

fields.name: parentAsin
fields.description:
Products with variations (size, color, etc.) have a Parent ASIN and Child
ASINs. The Parent ASIN represents the generic overall product
(non-purchasable).

fields.name: prepInstructions
fields.description: Which type of prep instructions are required, e.g., ASIN stickering, Boxing, Bubble wrapping, Shrinkwrap, Cap Sealing.

fields.name: prepInstructionsPerformedBy
fields.description: Differentiates if the prep instructions required will be performed by Amazon or the vendor.

fields.name: productGroup
fields.description:
The product group which describes the business group, as defined by the Amazon
catalog, e.g., PC, Wireless, Major Appliances.

fields.name: productTitle
fields.description: Product name.

fields.name: releaseDate
fields.description: The day that an item is available for purchase by the public.

fields.name: replenishmentCategory
fields.description: Availability status for the ASIN.

fields.name: shipToCity
fields.description: Customer City for a shipment.

fields.name: shipToCountryCode
fields.description: Customer Country Code for a shipment in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

fields.name: shipToStateOrProvince
fields.description: Customer State or Province for a shipment.

fields.name: shipToZipCode
fields.description: The shipment destination's ZIP Code.

fields.name: upc
fields.description: The Universal Product Code (UPC) used for retail packaging scanning at the point of sale.

fields.name: vendorCode
fields.description:
The hierarchy of vendor codes (parent-child relationships) plays an important
role in the storage and retrieval of vendor item information, for example,
cost (VCS) and external IDs (VXPS).
Child codes are generally assumed to be ordering codes that are for the same
vendor, represented by the parent vendor code.

types.name: Int
types.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Long
types.description: A Scalar for the primitive long type.

types.name: ManufacturingView
types.description:
The manufacturing view provides metrics about products manufactured by the Vendor for the given time period,
including both totals (aggregate across all of the vendor catalog) and metrics grouped by, e.g., ASIN.

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: End date of the time period.

fields.name: marketplaceId
fields.description: The marketplace identifier for the associated metrics.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Metrics for the given time period, grouped by, e.g., ASIN.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: Start date of the time period.

fields.name: totals
fields.description: Totals (aggregate across all of the vendor catalog) for the given time period.

types.name: ManufacturingViewMetrics
types.description: Metrics broken down by metric groups, e.g., Product availability, Orders, Costs, Customer satisfaction.

fields.name: costs
fields.description: Costs metric group.

fields.name: customerSatisfaction
fields.description: Customer satisfaction metric group.

fields.name: forecasting
fields.description: Forecasting metric group.

fields.name: orders
fields.description: Orders metric group.

fields.name: productAvailability
fields.description: Product availability metric group.

fields.name: shippedOrders
fields.description: Shipped orders metric group.

fields.name: sourcing
fields.description: Sourcing metric group.

fields.name: traffic
fields.description: Traffic metric group.

types.name: ManufacturingViewMetricsGroupedBy
types.description: Manufacturing view metrics grouped by the selected "group by" attributes, e.g., brand, ASIN.

fields.name: groupByKey
fields.description: Group by attributes, e.g., brand, ASIN.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Metrics for the given time period, grouped by the attributes selected in the groupByKey.

types.name: Orders
types.description: Orders metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: netOrderedGMS
fields.description: The net Gross Merchandise Sales (GMS) for all orders on a given day.

fields.name: netShipmentGMS
fields.description: The net shipped Gross Merchandise Sales (GMS) amount.

fields.name: orderedUnitsWithRevenue
fields.description:
The number of ordered units and the associated revenue in a given time period
with adjustments made for prior sales, like returns/cancellations. This metric
is also applicable for Kindle and Physical books. Ordered Revenue Amount (OPS)
= Product Price * Ordered Units.

fields.name: unfilledOrderedUnits
fields.description: Number of units ordered (or pre-ordered), but have not shipped.

types.name: ProductAvailability
types.description: Product availability metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: aged90DaysSellableInventory
fields.description:
The number of units and their cost that is at least 90 days old and in
sellable condition on the last day of the selected time frame.

fields.name: sellThroughRate
fields.description:
Calculated as the number of units shipped in comparison to the number of units
at Amazon at the start of the period, plus any units received during the same
time period. Sell Through Rate = (Shipped Units - Customer Returns) /
(Sellable On Hand Units + Net Received Units).

fields.name: sellableInTransitInventory
fields.description: The number of sellable units in transit inventory at the end of a specified time period.

fields.name: sellableOnHandInventory
fields.description: The number of units and their cost in Amazon FCs that is in sellable condition on the last day of the selected time frame.

fields.name: sourceableROOS
fields.description:
The sourceable replenishment out of stock percentage, which is the percentage
of retail that is available for all ASINs with a sourceable retail vendor.

fields.name: ultraFastTrack
fields.description:
Ultra Fast Track (UFT), is an hourly measure of the percentage of time an ASIN
is available to be shipped to the customer from an FC via Prime shipping,
versus the selection Amazon intended to carry. This metric takes into account
a Customer Importance Factor (CIF), which weighs the ASIN’s importance to
shoppers against Amazon’s cost of having that item in stock.

fields.name: unhealthyInventory
fields.description:
Excess number of units and their cost on the last day of the selected time
frame based on forecasted demand. (Note:Not Available for Daily/Custom Time selections)

fields.name: unsellableInTransitInventory
fields.description: The number of unsellable units in transit inventory at the end of a specified time period.

fields.name: unsellableOnHandInventory
fields.description:
The number of units and their cost in Amazon FCs that is in unsellable
condition on the last day of the selected time frame.

types.name: Query
types.description: A root type for queries

fields.name: analytics_vendorAnalytics_2024_09_30
fields.description: API is versioned.

types.name: ShippedOrders
types.description: Shipped orders metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: averageSellingPrice
fields.description:
The average selling price of shipped items, excluding sales tax or value-added
taxes. This is calculated by dividing revenue by the number of shipped units.

fields.name: shippedUnitsWithRevenue
fields.description:
The number of items shipped and the associated gross price the customer paid
for them. Shipped Revenue Amount = Gross Price (the price the customer sees in
the cart) * Shipped Units.

types.name: Sourcing
types.description: Sourcing metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: confirmedUnits
fields.description: Number of purchase order units that are confirmed to be shipped to Amazon.

fields.name: mostRecentSubmitted
fields.description: The number of units Amazon has ordered in the most recent purchase orders of the week.

fields.name: netReceived
fields.description:
Net number of units and their cost received by Amazon after subtracting the
units returned to the supplier in the selected time frame.

fields.name: openPurchaseOrderQuantity
fields.description: Number of units included in the Vendor's open POs (i.e., confirmed PO quantities that are not yet received).

fields.name: overallVendorLeadTime
fields.description: Time (in days) from when Vendor receives a PO from Amazon, to when inventory is received in a FC.

fields.name: procurableProductOOS
fields.description:
OOS (Out of Stock) rate on all products that are procurable. Retail Out of
Stock (ROOS) = Out of Stock Glance Views on Procurable ASINs / Total Glance
Views. Procurability refers to whether Amazon is able to fulfill a customer
delivery promise, considering the ability of known vendors to supply the ASIN
in the foreseeable future.

fields.name: receivedFillRate
fields.description:
PO units received by Amazon in comparison to PO units confirmed by the vendor.
The fill rate here applies only to Procurable ASINs. Fill Rate = Net Received
Units / Confirmed Units.

fields.name: vendorConfirmationRate
fields.description:
How many units Vendors confirm out of the units Amazon asks for, accounting
for Procurable ASINs only. Vendor Confirmation Rate = Confirmed Units /
Submitted Units.

types.name: SourcingView
types.description:
The sourcing view provides metrics about products that are sourced directly from
the Vendor to Amazon (i.e., when the Vendor is a distributor)
for the given time period, including both totals (aggregate across all of the
vendor catalog) and metrics grouped by, e.g., ASIN.

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: End date of the time period.

fields.name: marketplaceId
fields.description: The marketplace identifier for the associated metrics.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Metrics for the given time period, grouped by, e.g., ASIN.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: Start date of the time period.

fields.name: totals
fields.description: Totals (aggregate across all of the vendor catalog) for the given time period.

types.name: SourcingViewMetrics
types.description: Metrics broken down by metric groups, e.g., Product availability, Costs, Customer satisfaction.

fields.name: costs
fields.description: Costs metric group.

fields.name: customerSatisfaction
fields.description: Customer satisfaction metric group.

fields.name: productAvailability
fields.description: Product availability metric group.

fields.name: shippedOrders
fields.description: Shipped orders metric group.

fields.name: sourcing
fields.description: Sourcing metric group.

types.name: SourcingViewMetricsGroupedBy
types.description: Sourcing view metrics grouped by the selected "group by" attributes, e.g., brand, ASIN.

fields.name: groupByKey
fields.description: Group by attributes, e.g., brand, ASIN.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Metrics for the given time period, grouped by the attributes selected in the groupByKey.

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Traffic
types.description: Traffic metric group. A null value for a given metric means that the metric is not available.

fields.name: glanceViews
fields.description: Glance views where Retail is the featured offer (i.e., winning the buy box).

types.name: UnitsWithValue
types.description: Number of units with their corresponding monetary value.

fields.name: units
fields.description: Number of units.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Monetary value of the units.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.

directives.name: resultRetention
directives.description:
This directive specifies the retention duration of a query containing a
particular field. When a query contains multiple fields with different
retentions, the shortest (minimum) retention is applied to the query. The
retention of a query's resulting documents always matches the retention of the query.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
